Analysts

David Brockton

+44 20 3364 6780

david.brockton@execution-noble.com

Company Insight | Retail | 01 April 2011

Atkins (WS)

Going to plan

We make a marginal upgrade our Atkins forecasts to reflect improving liquidity in the Middle East, aiding debt recovery and greater demand. A more meaningful volume recovery for the group still feels at least twelve months away. However, opportunity exists in the interim as Atkins continues to enhance operational performance. Group resource is increasingly better aligned by endmarket and, with sentiment still generally against the sector, a gradual recovery could have a more immediate impact on the bottom line and valuation rating. Atkins trades on an unchallenging cal. 2011E P/E of 9.7x (vs. peers 10.6x). We would Buy now.

Marginal EPS upgrade; 3% for 2011 and 1% for 2012

To reflect reduced headcount in the UK, some debt recovery (c.£5m) and an improvement in activity across the Middle East we upgrade our EPS estimates by 3% for 2011 and 1% for 2012. Our key changes are summarised below:

Positioned for growth

The group continues to navigate challenging markets, flexing headcount to reflect anticipated market demand. This should become increasingly evident in prospects as gradual signs of recovery have an immediate impact on performance, with areas of pain already repositioned. As an example, the UK is now described as being at the bottom despite demand weakness in highways and environmental planning, which is offset by recovery in water and rail. It is the group’s diversity by endmarket and ability to flex resource, which we believe the market continues to underestimate.

US contribution and gradually improving conditions across the Middle East highlight a changing business mix and support to growth; providing confidence in forecasts and the valuation potential ahead of an eventual volume recovery. In our view, now is an opportune time to invest in well-managed infrastructure consultants, such as Atkins. Buy.
